captions.text: WHOO!

HI. I’M TOM MEDEMA,
A PARK RANGER

HERE IN YOSEMITE
NATIONAL PARK.

WINTER IN YOSEMITE IS
A PRETTY WELL-KEPT SECRET,

BUT I’M HERE TO TELL YOU,
IT’S SOMETHING THAT EVERYONE
CAN AND SHOULD ENJOY.

WHILE YOU MAY THINK THAT
WINTER DRIVING IN THE SIERRA
IS SOMETHING TO BE AVOIDED,

YOSEMITE’S ACTUALLY VERY
ACCESSIBLE THROUGHOUT
THE ENTIRE WINTER SEASON.

THE PARK HAS AMAZING CREWS
THAT KEEP THE ROADS CLEAR

IN ALL BUT THE MOST
MAJOR OF STORMS.

IT IS TRUE THAT YOU’LL
NEED TO CARRY TIRE CHAINS
IN YOUR VEHICLE,

BUT DRIVING TO YOSEMITE VALLEY
RARELY REQUIRES USING CHAINS

IF YOU ENTER THE PARK
ON HIGHWAY 140 THROUGH MARIPOSA.

STILL, CHAINS CAN BE A NECESSARY
AND EVEN ADVENTUROUS PART
OF VISITING IN WINTER.

AND LET’S NOT FORGET,
THERE’S DAILY BUS SERVICE
TO YOSEMITE VALLEY FROM MERCED.

SO, IF YOU WANT,
YOU CAN JUST RELAX

AND LEAVE THE WINTER DRIVING
TO A PROFESSIONAL.

HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS LIKE
TIOGA ROAD, GLACIER POINT,

AND MARIPOSA GROVE ARE CLOSED
TO VEHICLES IN THE WINTER,

BUT MOST OF THE PARK’S
ROADS REMAIN OPEN.

HOTELS AND RESTAURANTS
BUZZ WITH ACTIVITY,

AND MANY OFFER SPECIAL
RATES AND EVENTS

THAT JUST ADD
TO THE EXPERIENCE.

ONCE YOU REALIZE THAT
YOSEMITE’S AN ACCESSIBLE
PLAYGROUND IN THE WINTER,

THE DOORS ARE WIDE OPEN
TO NEW ADVENTURES.

SOME OF THE TRAILS
IN YOSEMITE VALLEY

ARE OFTEN CLEAR ENOUGH
FOR HIKING IN WINTER,
LIKE THIS ONE.
THIS IS THE VALLEY LOOP TRAIL,

WHICH WINDS THROUGH SOME OF THE
MOST CLASSIC AND ICONIC SCENERY
IN YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK.

THE YOSEMITE FALLS TRAIL
IS ANOTHER GREAT OPTION,

BECAUSE IT GETS
A LOT OF WINTER SUN

AND CAN BE QUITE DRY
ON THE LOWER SECTIONS.

Woman: YOSEMITE VALLEY
IS A GREAT PLACE TO VISIT
IN THE WINTER

BECAUSE YOU HAVE SO MUCH
FREEDOM TO STROLL AROUND
AT YOUR LEISURE

AND SEE THINGS
AT YOUR PACE.

AND EVEN IF YOU’RE HERE
WHEN A STORM BLOWS IN

OR IF IT’S A LITTLE
CHILLY FOR YOU,

THERE’S LOTS OF INDOOR OPTIONS
TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF.

THE YOSEMITE VALLEY
VISITOR CENTER--

RANGERS, OF COURSE, AVAILABLE
IN THE VISITOR CENTER
FOR YOU TO SPEND TIME WITH.

BEHIND THAT
VISITOR CENTER AREA

IS A THEATER WHERE YOU CAN WATCH
"THE SPIRIT OF YOSEMITE."

AND THEN RIGHT NEXT DOOR
TO ALL OF THOSE FACILITIES
IS THE INDIAN CULTURE MUSEUM,

AND THAT’S A GREAT PLACE
TO EXPLORE SOME OF
THE HUMAN HISTORY.

Medema: ANOTHER GREAT WINTER
ACTIVITY IN YOSEMITE

IS ICE SKATING
IN CURRY VILLAGE.

THIS HAS BEEN A TRADITION
IN YOSEMITE VALLEY FOR DECADES

AND IS STILL A MEMORABLE
WAY TO SPEND TIME

UNDER THE TALL PINES
AND THE TOWERING CLIFFS.

BUT PERHAPS THE BEST THING
ABOUT VISITING IN WINTER

IS JUST GETTING OUT
AND ENJOYING THE SNOW.

THERE ARE SNOW PLAY AREAS
NEAR TWO OF OUR PARK ENTRANCES

SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED
FOR GETTING OUT AND
HAVING FUN IN THE SNOW.
HA HA HA HA!
AH HA HA HA!

Man: IF YOU FIND YOURSELF
IN YOSEMITE ONE DAY,
CONGRATULATIONS.

AND IF YOU FIND YOURSELF
IN YOSEMITE ONE DAY

IN THE MIDDLE OF WINTER,
EVEN BETTER.

WHAT I ENCOURAGE YOU TO DO
IS TRY SNOWSHOEING.

IT’S A LOT OF HARD WORK,
BUT AT THE SAME TIME
IT’S A LOT OF FUN,

AND THERE’S AN EVEN MORE
IMPORTANT COMPONENT,

AND THAT’S THE COMPONENT
OF DISCOVERY.

WHENEVER YOU GO OUT
INTO A MEADOW OR A FOREST
AFTER A MAJOR WINTER STORM,

IT ALWAYS FEELS LIKE
YOU’RE THE FIRST PERSON

TO EVER HAVE STEPPED FOOT
IN THAT PARTICULAR AREA.

THERE’S ALWAYS
A SENSE OF DISCOVERY,

AND THERE’S ALWAYS A SENSE
OF CONTROL AND SILENCE

AND STILLNESS AND WONDER
AND BEAUTY.

ALL THOSE THINGS ARE ALL WRAPPED
UP IN THE QUIET OF THE SNOW.

WELL, HERE WE ARE
AT BADGER PASS,

ONE OF THE MOST HISTORIC
AND IMPORTANT SKI AREAS
IN THE AMERICAN WEST.

PEOPLE HAVE BEEN SLIDING
ON THE SNOW AT BADGER FOR THE
BETTER PART OF A CENTURY.

NO LONG LIFT LINES,
NO CONDOS, NO PRETENSE.

JUST GREAT NATURAL SNOW,
AMAZING INSTRUCTION,
AN INCREDIBLE SUN DECK,

AND GREAT SKIING
AND SNOWBOARDING FOR
THE ENTIRE FAMILY.
HA HA HA!

IF QUIETER EXPLORATION
IS MORE YOUR STYLE,

CROSS-COUNTRY SKIING
IS DEFINITELY WORTH A TRY.

JUST A FEW HUNDRED YARDS OF
SKIING CAN TAKE YOU WORLDS AWAY

FROM THE NOISE
OF CIVILIZATION.

THE SILENCE OF THIS LANDSCAPE
UNDER SNOW IS A MAGICAL
THING TO EXPERIENCE.

FOR BEGINNERS, IT’S EASY TO
RENT EQUIPMENT, TAKE LESSONS,
AND GO ON GUIDED TRIPS.

FOR MORE SKILLED SKIERS,
THERE ARE LONG-DISTANCE
GROOMED TRAILS

AND BOUNDLESS
BACK-COUNTRY TERRAIN.

WOW, THERE IS SO MUCH
FUN AND EXCITEMENT TO BE HAD
IN YOSEMITE IN THE WINTERTIME.

THE PARK IS REALLY ACCESSIBLE,
THE CROWDS ARE SMALL,

THERE ARE SO MANY NEW THINGS
TO DISCOVER AND ENJOY.

YOU REALLY NEED TO
COME CHECK IT OUT.

SO WHEN YOU’RE THINKING ABOUT
YOUR NEXT VISIT TO YOSEMITE,

PICTURE YOSEMITE VALLEY
DRAPED IN A BLANKET OF WHITE

WITH PLENTY OF ROOM TO STAY
AND PLENTY OF ROOM TO PLAY.

YOSEMITE IN WINTER. THERE IS
NO PLACE LIKE IT ON EARTH.
